description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a). 17 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Light cream paper with chain and laid lines visible (frame-ruled). On fol. 188a-b: Verses of poetry. Foliation in red ink using Arabic numerals. Several inscriptions, including ownership statements on fol. 1a. Mildewed. Copy completed on Yawm al-thulathā 28 Jumādá al-Awwal 889 (colophon, fol. 187b). Incipit: قال العبد الفقير ... محمد بن حسن بن علي النواجى الشافعى ... اما بعد حمد الله الذي خلق الانسان فى احسن تقويم ... فقد سالني بعض الاخوان ان اجمع له نبذة فى الحسان من الغلمان Explicit: لو لم تكن روضة للحسن او فلكا ما كان جمع فيك الغصن والقمر لكان هذا ابلغ فى المعنا وحسبنا الله ونعم الوكيل
author: Nawājī, Muḥammad ibn Ḥasan, 1386-1455
abstract: A collection of poems describing handsome youths.
alternative: مراتع الغزلان في وصف الحسان من الغلمان
extent: i, 188, i leaves: paper ; 180 x 135 (117 x 90) mm.
title: Kitāb Marātiʻ al-ghizlān fī waṣf al-ghilmān al-ḥisān
uniform title: مراتع الغزلان في وصف الغلمان الحسان
provenance: Several ownership statements on fol. 1a, one signed Āl Biṭrīq al-Ḥusaynī Sibṭ ---?. Ownership statement signed Ibrāhīm Ḥasūn (?) dated 1138 H. on the margin of fol. 1b. Acquired by Robert Garrett from Brill, Leyden, 1904.
creator: نواجي، محمد بن حسن
subject: Love poetry, Arabic—14th century
binding note: Dark brown leather over paper pasteboards for upper and lower cover, fore-edge flap and envelope-flap. Both covers have an elaborate blind-tooled panel, with a central mandorla with two pendants on the vertical axis. Vertical fillets link the central mandorla to an outer frame made of fillets, with a s-shape running pattern and a small floral stamp in the corners. Paper pastedowns.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
